page_content:
![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg)

# State of Health and Driver's Licences

In Québec, all drivers must satisfy health requirements, including vision. They are also required to notify the SAAQ of any change that could hinder their ability to drive.

Anyone who has doubts about another person's ability to safely drive a vehicle can notify the SAAQ. You must be able to provide identifying information, such as the person's:

- driver's licence number;
- first and last name and date of birth;
- first and last name and address;
- first and last name and licence plate number.

The licence plate number on its own is not sufficient.

You can file an anonymous report by phone at 1-800-361-7620, or by mail:

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19500, succursale Terminus, N-4-14

Québec (Québec) G1K 8J5

You can also file a [report online through secure email](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/reach-us/positive-feedback-complaint-comment/on-your-own-behalf), but you will have to identify yourself.

Any information received is analyzed as soon as possible.

- ## 1 What you should know

### Mandatory medical assessments: for your safety and the safety of others

Regardless of the vehicle you drive or your age, driving requires sound physical and mental health, along with good vision.

page_content:
Regardless of the vehicle you drive or your age, driving requires sound physical and mental health, along with good vision.

In addition to the mandatory medical assessments - for which we will send you **a letter** - you must notify us of any change in your state of health that could hinder your ability to drive within 30 days of that change.

The frequency of the medical assessments or vision tests varies according to:

- the [class of driver's licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/drivers-licence-classes)
- your age
- your state of health (for example, if an illness is reported that can affect your ability to drive)

If you hold a **Class 5** licence (passenger vehicle), a **Class** **6A, 6B, 6C or 6E** licence (motorcycle), a **Class** **6D** licence (moped or scooter) or a **Class 8** licence (farm tractor), once you turn 75, you must disclose your state of health using the [Self-Declaration of Medical Information (PDF, 145.5 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/self-declaration-medical-information.pdf) form. You will be sent a copy of the form along with an explanatory letter 45 days before your birthday. Following the analysis of your self-declaration, medical forms may be requested.

page_content:
**Once you turn 80, and every two years thereafter**, you will have to undergo a health assessment . You will be sent the forms to be completed by the appropriate health care professional 45 days before your birthday, along with an explanatory letter.

If you hold a **Class 1, 2, or 3** licence (road tractor, bus, straight-body truck), a **Class 4A or 4B** licence (emergency vehicle or minibus), you are required to provide us with a medical report on your state of health:

- at ages 45, 55, 60 and 65
- every 2 years thereafter

To drive a vehicle in the **United States** that requires a **Class 1, 2, 3 or 4B** licence, assessments are required:

- at ages 20, 25, 30, 35, 40 and 45
- at ages 48, 51, 54, 55, 57, 60, 63 and 65
- every year thereafter

### Make your medical appointment as soon as possible

In order to prevent the suspension of your licence or of your right to obtain one, you must make an appointment as soon as possible with your health care professional and send us the [Report on a Person's State of Health (PDF, 287.0 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/medical-examination-report-28.pdf) before the prescribed deadline.

## 2 What you must do

- ## 3 You will soon reach the age of 75 or 80 and you have received a letter

Even if you are in good health and have many years of driving experience, certain health or vision problems may appear with age.

### At age 75

All **drivers aged 75** must declare their state of health using the [Self-Declaration of Medical Information (PDF, 145.5 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/self-declaration-medical-information.pdf) form. The form will be mailed to you along with an explanatory letter 45 days before your 75th birthday.

PROCEDURE TO SUBMIT YOUR MEDICAL SELF-DECLARATION

**Online**

You can fill out the form directly in [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login) or upload a copy.

**By mail**

You can use the form that will be mailed to you 45 days before your birthday, or you can print and fill out the [Self-Declaration of Medical Information (PDF, 145.5 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/self-declaration-medical-information.pdf) form and return it to the address provided.

**In person**

You can go to a [service outlet⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet "") to hand in your form.

### As of age 80

Every **driver aged 80** or over must undergo a health assessment every two years.

#### What the medical examination allows us to check

page_content:
### As of age 80

Every **driver aged 80** or over must undergo a health assessment every two years.

#### What the medical examination allows us to check

- Your general state of health
- Your mobility (ranges of motion, for example when you turn your head)
- Your cognitive functions (behaviour, memory, attention, etc.)

#### What the vision test allows us to check

- Your distance and peripheral (side) vision
- Any problem that can reduce your ability to drive safely, such as:
- cataracts
- glaucoma
- macular degeneration

#### Don't worry...

Contrary to what you may think, very few people who undergo a medical examination or vision test lose their licence.

However, several drivers subsequently have conditions to respect, e.g. avoiding driving at night, having to wear eyeglasses to drive, etc.

When a medical examination reveals problems that could hinder a person's ability to drive, we sometimes have the person undergo a road test in order to render an informed decision about the licence.

- ## 4 Medical examination

- ### Other websites

- [Portail santé mieux-être⁠ ⁠](http://www.sante.gouv.qc.ca/en/repertoire-ressources/)

You have to schedule an appointment with a physician or specialized nurse practitioner of your choice.

On the day of the appointment, bring the forms we enclosed with your letter for the chosen health care professional to fill out and sign.

### Finding a physician

page_content:
On the day of the appointment, bring the forms we enclosed with your letter for the chosen health care professional to fill out and sign.

### Finding a physician

We cannot help you find a physician, nor can we help you schedule an appointment more quickly. If you do not have a family physician, consult the government's health and wellness portal to [find a resource⁠ ⁠](https://www.quebec.ca/en/health/health-system-and-services/service-organization/primary-care-health-and-social-services) near your home that offers medical consultations without an appointment.

### Finding a specialized nurse practitioner

You must contact your CISSS or CIUSSS to find out whether any primary care specialized nurse practitioners work in your area. In most cases, you must be registered on your region's patient waiting list through your CISSS or CIUSSS. When spots open for new patients, you will be contacted.

### Schedule your appointment as soon as possible

It is important that you send us the [Report on a Person's State of Health (PDF, 287.0 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/medical-examination-report-28.pdf) before the deadline indicated in your letter to avoid the suspension of your driver's licence or your right to obtain one.

However, under certain conditions, you can apply for a deadline extension through [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

- ## 5 Vision test

- ### Delivery time frame

page_content:
- ## 5 Vision test

- ### Delivery time frame

- Before the deadline indicated in your letter
- ### Documents to provide

- Examination form duly completed and signed by an optometrist or an ophthalmologist

You have to schedule an appointment with an optometrist who is a member of the [Ordre des optométristes du Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.ooq.org/) or with an [ophthalmologist⁠ ⁠](http://www.amoq.org/) (websites in French only).

On the day of the test, bring the forms we enclosed with your letter for the optometrist or ophthalmologist to fill out and sign.

### Finding an optometrist or an ophthalmologist

We cannot help you find an optometrist or an ophthalmologist, nor can we help you schedule an appointment more quickly. We suggest you go to the website of the [Ordre des optométristes du Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.ooq.org/) or the [Association des médecins ophtalmologistes du Québec⁠ ⁠](http://www.amoq.org/) (websites in French only) to find one in your region.

### Schedule an appointment as soon as possible

It is important that you send us the [eye examination report (PDF, 253.2 KB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/extranet_sante/sante-conducteur/formulaires/6205A_30.pdf) before the deadline indicated in your letter to avoid the suspension of your driver's licence or your right to obtain one.

- ## 6 Sending the reports

page_content:
- ## 6 Sending the reports

Once your reports have been completed and signed by the physician or specialized nurse practitioner or the optometrist or ophthalmologist, there are 3 ways you can send them to us:

### Online

You can upload your reports to your [SAAQclic ⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login) account.

### By mail

You can send your reports to:

Service de l'évaluation médicale et du suivi du comportement

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19500, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec) G1K 8J5

### In person

You can go to a [service outlet](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet) to hand in your reports.

### Pay attention to the deadline!

It is important that you send us your reports before the deadline indicated in your letter to avoid the suspension of your driver's licence or your right to obtain one.

However, under certain conditions, you can apply for a deadline extension through [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

- ## 7 Processing the reports and our decision

- ### Publications

- [Have You Received an Unfavourable Medical Decision Concerning Your Driver's Licence? (PDF, 447.1 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/unfavourable-medical-decision-licence.pdf)
- ### See also

- [Contesting a Decision](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/contesting-decision)

After we have analyzed your report(s), we will either:

page_content:
- [Contesting a Decision](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/contesting-decision)

After we have analyzed your report(s), we will either:

- maintain your driver's licence
- maintain your driver's licence and add certain [conditions](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/conditions-added-to-licence)
- request additional information
- request that you take a road test at an SAAQ service centre
- request that you undergo an assessment conducted by an occupational therapist in public or private practice who specializes in driver assessments
- suspend your driver's licence
- deny your application for a driver's licence

**Rest assured!**

You should know that **very few people** have their driver's licence withdrawn after a medical examination or vision test. However, some people have to respect certain conditions to be allowed to continue to drive. For example:

- avoiding driving at night
- wearing corrective lenses to drive
- driving a vehicle equipped with an automatic transmission

- ## 8 You are a professional driver and you have received a letter

- ### Publications

- [Obligations of Heavy Vehicle Users (PDF, 5.9 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/obligations-heavy-vehicles-users.pdf)
- [Medical Assessment to Drive in the United States (PDF, 433.1 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/medical-assessment-drive-usa.pdf)

page_content:
All holders of a **Class 1, 2, 3, 4A or 4B** licence must undergo a **medical examination**:

- at ages 45, 55, 60 and 65
- every 2 years after age 65

If you drive a vehicle that requires a **Classe 1, 2, 3 or 4B** licence in the **United States**, the assessments are required:

- at ages 20, 25, 30, 35, 40 and 45
- at ages 48, 51, 54, 55, 57, 60, 63 and 65
- every year after age 65

- ## 9 Medical examination

- ### Publications

- [Obligations of Heavy Vehicle Users (PDF, 5.9 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/obligations-heavy-vehicles-users.pdf)
- ### Other websites

- [Portail santé mieux-être⁠ ⁠](http://www.sante.gouv.qc.ca/en/repertoire-ressources/)

You have to schedule an appointment with a physician or specialized nurse practitioner of your choice.

On the day of the appointment, bring the forms we enclosed with your letter for the chosen health care professional to fill out and sign.

### Finding a physician

We cannot help you find a physician, nor can we help you schedule an appointment more quickly. If you do not have a family physician, consult the government's health and wellness portal to [find a resource⁠ ⁠](https://www.quebec.ca/en/health/health-system-and-services/service-organization/primary-care-health-and-social-services) near your home that offers medical consultations without an appointment.

### Finding a specialized nurse practitioner

### Finding a specialized nurse practitioner

You must contact your CISSS or CIUSSS to find out whether any primary care specialized nurse practitioners work in your area. In most cases, you must be registered on your region's patient waiting list through your CISSS or CIUSSS. When spots open for new patients, you will be contacted.

### Schedule your appointment as soon as possible

It is important that you send us the [Report on a Person's State of Health (PDF, 287.0 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/medical-examination-report-28.pdf) before the deadline indicated in your letter to avoid the suspension of your driver's licence or your right to obtain one.

However, under certain conditions, you can apply for a deadline extension through [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

- ## 10 Sending the reports

Once your reports have been completed and signed by the physician or specialized nurse practitioner or the optometrist or ophthalmologist, there are 3 ways you can send them to us :

### Online

You can upload your reports to your [SAAQclic ⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login) account.

### By mail

You can send your reports to:

Service de l'évaluation médicale et du suivi du comportement

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19500, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec) G1K 8J5

### In person

page_content:
Service de l'évaluation médicale et du suivi du comportement

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19500, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec) G1K 8J5

### In person

You can go to a [service outlet](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet) to hand in your reports.

### Pay attention to the deadline!

It is important that you send us your reports before the deadline indicated in your letter to avoid the suspension of your driver's licence or your right to obtain one.

However, under certain conditions, you can apply for a deadline extension through [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

- ## 11 Processing the reports and our decision

- ### Publications

- [Have You Received an Unfavourable Decision Concerning Your Driver's Licence? (PDF, 447.1 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/unfavourable-medical-decision-licence.pdf)
- ### See also

- [Contesting a Decision](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/contesting-decision)

After we have analyzed your report(s), we will either:

page_content:
- [Contesting a Decision](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/contesting-decision)

After we have analyzed your report(s), we will either:

- maintain your driver's licence
- maintain your driver's licence and add certain [conditions](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/conditions-added-to-licence)
- request additional information
- request that you take a road test at an SAAQ service centre
- request that you undergo an assessment conducted by an occupational therapist in public or private practice who specializes in driver assessments
- suspend your driver's licence
- deny your application for a driver's licence

- ## 12 Your state of health has changed

You are required to report any health problem that could hinder your ability to drive safely, regardless of your age or the class of licence you hold.

You must notify us if your state of health has changed:

- before obtaining a driver's licence or a new class of licence
- at the time of your driver's licence payment or renewal
- at any time, within **30 days** of a diagnosis

We will study your declaration and send you a letter informing you of our assessment of the situation.

If your state of health has changed, there are different ways you can inform us:

### Online

You can make your medical declaration through your [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login) account in the State of Health section.

### By mail

page_content:
### Online

You can make your medical declaration through your [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login) account in the State of Health section.

### By mail

You can send your [self-declaration form (PDF, 145.5 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/self-declaration-medical-information.pdf) or the detachable portion of your annual driver's licence renewal notice to:

Service de l'évaluation médicale et du suivi du comportement

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19500, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec) G1K 8J5

### In person

You can go to a [service outlet⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet "") to hand in your self-declaration form.

- ## 13 Processing your declaration

After studying your declaration, we will either:

- maintain your driver's licence
- maintain your driver's licence and add certain [conditions](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/conditions-added-to-licence)
- request additional information

- ## 14 No action is required on your part

From the answers you have provided, you do not appear to have any obligations to fulfill to keep your licence.

Last update: May 22, 2025

- ## Publications

page_content:
From the answers you have provided, you do not appear to have any obligations to fulfill to keep your licence.

Last update: May 22, 2025

- ## Publications

- [Health in the Driver's Seat (PDF, 6.4 MB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/driver-seat-health.pdf)
- [Why a Medical Assessment? (PDF, 237.1 KB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/why-medical-assessment.pdf)
- ## See also

- [Conditions That Can Be Added to a Licence](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/conditions-added-to-licence)
- ## Laws and regulations

- [Regulation respecting the health of drivers⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/ShowDoc/cr/C-24.2,%20r.%2040.1)

## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That's why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
